container.heading: Risk Retention Groups and Purchasing Groups—Fees

section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: This chapter is promulgated to aid in the effectuation of Insurance Article, Title 25, Subtitle 1, Annotated Code of Maryland, and establishes reasonable fees to defray the costs incurred by the Insurance Administration in carrying out these requirements.

section.heading: Applicability.
section.text: This chapter shall apply to all:

para.text: Risk retention groups seeking to be chartered in this State;
Risk retention groups chartered in a state other than this State and seeking to do business in this State; and
Purchasing groups which intend to do business in this State.
Domestic risk retention groups shall pay the following nonrefundable fees to the Commissioner:
Submission of plan of operation or feasibility study—$50;
Annual continuation of certificate of authority—$25.
Foreign risk retention groups shall pay the following nonrefundable fees to the Commissioner:
Submission of plan of operation or feasibility study—$50;
Purchasing groups shall pay to the Commissioner a nonrefundable registration fee of $100 upon submission of intent to do business in Maryland.

annotations.annotation: Insurance Article, §§2-109, 25-102, 25-103, and 25-106(c), Annotated Code of Maryland
